description: Don Quixote with raised sword seizing a Moor puppet with left hand; set falling over; puppeteer leaning out of box; Sancho Panza at right; light swinging from ceiling
inscription:
Signature, Title, and Inscription

on sheet below image in black: [Don Quixote takes the Puppets to be Turks, and/attacks them to rescue two flying Lovers/ Car. Coypel pinx.  sold by G. Vander Gucht in Queen Street Bloomsbury];; in pencil on sheet at bottom: [1-317]; in pencil on sheet upper left:[10]
title: Don Quixote takes the Puppets to be Turks and Attacks Them to Rescue Two Flying Lovers
